welcomesubheader: A quality-of-life and data tracking framework for the game Faster Than Light.
welcomefirst: First, we need to find where your game is located.
welcomeopt2: window (which may also be accessed using the wrench icon in the sidebar), and configure the path to the FTL executable using the Browse button.
langconfirm: Changing the language requires reloading the user interface. Do you wish to do this now?
settings_ftl_loc_long: This should be set to the main FTL game executable (FTLGame.exe). Please see the online documentation page for more information on how to locate this for common versions installed through Steam, GoG, etc.
settings_ftl_compat_full_tip: The version of FTL that was selected is fully compatible. All Subspace features are available.
settings_ftl_compat_partial_tip: The version of FTL that was selected is partially compatible. Basic functionality will work, but some features are not available.
settings_ftl_compat_incompat_tip: The version of FTL that was selected is invalid or is not compatible with Subspace.
settings_ftl_compat_unknown_tip: No file is selected or the compatibility is otherwise unknown.
settings_saveoverride_tip:
By default FTL stores its save files under the user's Documents folder.

This option allows you to choose a different location to store the save files instead.
settings_saveoverride_user_tip:
Instead of a fixed location, store the save files under a "user" subfolder of the FTL game installation.

This can be useful if you switch between different copies of the game and want to use a different profile for each.
ftl_howtoplay3: Or load historical data using the menu.
ftl_newgame: To start a run, begin a new game or continue a saved game in FTL.
ftl_gopractice: Alternatively, if the practice mode feature is enabled, you can load a practice save through the menu.
settings_features_explainer:
Tip: Once setup is complete, go to the Features page on the left and activate one or more features.

By default Subspace behaves as pure vanilla FTL. Enabling features allows you to choose exactly which modifications you wish to use. Once features are activated, more settings will appear that can be used to configure them further.
feature_frameadv_desc: Enables a hotkey that advances the game state by a single frame while paused. This feature provides a more convenient way to micropause as well as making it accessible to people with physical conditions that make it difficult to press space and middle mouse button simultaneously.
feature_infoblock_desc: Displays a customziable block of information in the top-right corner of the screen, such as game version or FPS.
feature_numerichull_desc: Alters the hull display label to show the remaining hull in numeric form, without having to count the bars by hand.
feature_timewarp_desc: Enables hotkeys to speed up time and skip over boring parts.
feature_tweaks_desc: A catch-all feature for one-off tweaks that do not fit in any other category.
